title: For Sale:  World War I Remington Bayonet with scabbard
postcontent: This listing is for one Remington M1917 Bayonet with Green leather scabbard. The blade is 16 1/2 inches in length with a cutting edge of almost 15 inches. The overall length of the M-1917 bayonet is 21 3/4 inches. The blade has original blade edge and shows no sign of rusting or modifications. This bayonet has not been drilled for the "clearing hole" in the end of the stud slot to allow dirt or debris to be removed from the end of the slot. This was done fairly early in production, probably in October or November of 1917. Some of the earlier bayonets were retrofitted with this hole, so US marked M1917 bayonets without the clearing hole are fairly uncommon.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg No.46 .22 Caliber Bolt Action Rifle / C&R
postcontent:
Mossberg No.46 .22 Caliber Bolt Action Rifle / C&R  

NOTE: Make sure that this firearm is legal to own in your state and/or locality.

Offered for your consideration is one (1), Mossberg No.46 .22 caliber bolt action rifle. Manufactured during the years of 1935 thru 1937 it features the No. 4 receiver peep sight, and 1A ramp front sight. There were no barrel sights for this rifle, however, it is factory drilled & tapped to accept the Mossberg side scope mount of the period. Considering its’ age, this No.46 is in remarkable condition. With the exception of the gold bead in the 1A front sight and front sight hood, (which are can be seen in the pictures), it is complete. The aperture for the No.4 receiver peep sight is a high quality reproduction of the original one for a No. 4 peep sight. On some models of the 46 the the Mossberg 4A receiver peep sight is found which has the 4A aperture from which the shooter can select one of four different size apertures to use. The receiver peep sight on this rifle is the standard Mossberg No.4 peep sight. The walnut stock has no cracks or splits; however, there are several shallow depressions on the bottom of the beavertail forend. These can also be seen in the pictures. title: For Trade:  Belgium made Browning A5-16 gauge ~ Looking for quality pistol
postcontent:
Looking to trade my Belgium made Browning A5-16 gauge for a nice pistol. Preferable I would like a 9mm but would look at other calibers. 

She is in very nice and well loved condition throughout, only showing light handling marks, mostly confined to the forearm. Probable one of the cleanest I have ever seen for this age.  As with all Browning A5 16 gauges of this age, it was originally manufactured for 2 9/16 shotgun shells that were popular in Europe at the time. It was converted by Browning to accept the now-standard 2-3/4" shells. 

Operates/cycles flawlessly; I still use her for a rabbit and skeet gun, even took her out last weekend. The Receiver and Bore are in excellent condition and she has the hard to find “suicide/sliding safety”. (This was the sliding safety that goes front-back through the trigger guard.)

I would be more than happy to spend some time with who ever I trade with, go over the correct way to break her down, how to set up the gas rings for shot size and tips/tricks that some old timers taught me along the way. I also have a copy of the original manual that might come in handy. These older Browning A5’s were incredible hand made firearms; even the assemble screws were proof tested and marked. The wood is hand checkered, no cracks and in truly awesome condition. She is the perfect heirloom gun if you’re looking for a “safe queen”, or is ready for every day use. Operates the same way she did 85 years ago, and really feels good in your hands.

 Offered for your consideration is one (1) Mossberg 44US – U.S. Property marked .22 bolt action training rifle. These rifles were ordered by the government to use as trainers for new troops preparing to enter the combat theaters of World War II. This 44US was one of 7,000 manufactured by O.F. title: For Trade:  Casio LK-220 Lighted Keyboard 61-Key with MP3 USB Port
postcontent:
The LK-220 introduces those who are just learning to play the keyboard to the new Step-Up learning system from CASIO. Practice pieces are divided into small sections allowing the student to learn a step at a time. And that's not all; the LK-220 has plenty more to offer, including the new AHL sound source boasting 48 notes of polyphony, 150 rhythms, an extended automatic accompaniment feature with ON-bass chord and a large, easy-to-read display. The sampling function provides hours of fun: recordings from the mic input of up to a second can be played back via the keyboard.


A great beginning keyboard with illuminated keys. 

Lessons are displayed on the LCD. 

Keys illuminate to show you what notes to play in lessons or built-in songs. 

Touch-Sensitive Lighted Keyboard
The LK-220 features 61 piano-style keys with 48-note polyphony. The "LK" in LK-220 stands for "Lighted Keyboard." Designed to provide a fun way to learn how to play music, the keys illuminate to show you what notes to play in lessons or built-in songs. 

400 Built-In Tones
Find just the right sound with 400 built-in tones, from strings to woodwinds and plenty more. 

Ten Reverb Effects
Select from ten different reverb effects to add depth to your performance. 

USB Port
For many musicians, the computer has become a music-making center. Connect the LK-220 to a computer using a USB cable and exchange MIDI data between the two devices. Send play data from the keyboard to music software running on your computer, or send MIDI data from your computer to the keyboard for playback. 

150 Built-In Rhythms
The LK-220 comes with a wealth of built-in rhythm patterns, from latin to rock. Auto Accompaniment features include Start/Stop, Intro, Normal/Fill-In, Variation/Fill-In, and Synchro/Ending. 

Step Up Lessons
To master a song, it is best to break it up into shorter parts (phrases), master the phrases, and then put everything together. The LK-220 features a "Step Up Lesson" feature that helps you to do just that. The built-in songs are pre-divided into phrases to help you master keyboard play. Step Up Lesson takes you through practice of the right hand part, left hand part, and both hand parts for each phrase of a song. Master all of the phrases and you master the song. 

Transpose Function
An easy operation instantly changes the key of the keyboard. 

Audio Input
Play along with MP3 or CD players or other devices by plugging them into the stereo mini input jack. 

Battery or AC Power
Power the LK-220 with six AA-sized batteries or purchase a separate AC adapter to power from your electrical outlets. Built-in 2 x 2W speakers make the keyboard entirely portable. 

Built-In Sampling
You can use the Digital Keyboard to sample a sound from a microphone, and then play the sound with keyboard keys. For example, you could sample the bark of your dog and then use the sound in a melody. The sampling feature is a great way to create new sounds that are highly creative. 

This Keyboard is like new only been used for like 30 mins!! Comes with Keyboard stand and AC adapter.

title: For Sale:  Partially machined AR 15 lower receiver forging
postcontent:
For sale I have a few partially machined AR 15 lower receiver forgings.  These forgings have the most difficult machining functions already performed.  These functions would be the mag well, and the exterior profile.  These functions require expensive machine tools to perform correctly (EDM or broach for the magwell, cnc mill for the profile).  The take-down pin holes are machined as well, so you have great zero indicators should you choose to finish the lower yourself.  The remaining machining functions can be performed on a hand mill or lathe, or possibly even a drill press.  

I like these lower receivers for a few reasons.  First, I think finishing one would be a fun challenge.  They are completely blank, meaning I can engrave my own unique roll mark, as well as any other markings I want.  They are "in the white", meaning I can choose to anodize them in any custom color I want. The customization aspect is neat.  Personally, I think a lower receiver anodized in british racing green would be super cool:

The possibilities are endless.  The beauty of these is that you can make them however you want.  You get the idea:





Of course, you could also leave them just the way they are, and have a really neat decoration, discussion piece, gift idea, etc.

Since this is an unfinished receiver, it does not qualify as a legal firearm.  This means no paperwork is necessary.  As far as the law is concerned, it may as well be an aluminum baseball bat.
